byline.original: By JAMES RISEN and MATTHEW ROSENBERG

abstract: Private security industry, which came to worldwide attention with legacy of Blackwater, now extends beyond Iraq and Afghanistan, with bit players on fringe of global conflicts now matured to multinational companies that protect oil fields, analyze American intelligence and help fight insurgents; security firms say they have made sure their guards are well trained and act professionally.
lead_paragraph: Private security firms have matured from bit players on the edge of global conflicts to multinational companies that guard oil fields, analyze intelligence and fight insurgents.

headline.main: Blackwater’s Legacy Goes Beyond Public View
headline.print_headline: Blackwater’s Legacy Goes Beyond Public View

snippet: Private security firms have matured from bit players on the edge of global conflicts to multinational companies that guard oil fields, analyze intelligence and fight insurgents.
